newsitem.title: USA: Thiokol to supply rocket boosters to Japan.
newsitem.headline: Thiokol to supply rocket boosters to Japan.

text.p: Thiokol Corp on Wednesday said the National Space Development Agency of Japan selected the company's CASTOR(R) IVA-XL solid rocket motors as strap-on boosters for its newest launch vehicle.
Contract details have not been completed, but Thiokol said expected the initial contract to be worth $50 million.
Mitsubishi Heavy Industries Ltd's Nagoya Aerospace Systems Division will be Thiokol's customer for the purchase of the CASTOR IVA-XL booster motor, the company said.
The launch vehicle, H-IIA, is an upgraded, lower-cost, commercial version of the vehicle currently used by Japan's Tanegashima Space Center, Thiokol said.
The steel-cased rocket motor weighs about 33,000 pounds and supplies more than 150,000 pounds of thrust during its 56-second burn.
